comments:
I created a bunch of semantic nodes and views without corresponding notation views. I have canonical edit policies that create views for these semantic elements. When opening a file that only contains semantic elements (no notation elements) I get the following stack trace (and all the nodes are not lay-ed out)

Aparently, one of the notation edges doesn't have a target and it's causing NPE. Auto-layout should be able to tolerate null target (or source) connections of edges.

Why does you notation edge not have a target?  Does this imply a corrupt diagram file?

Yes, it's probably a corrupt diagram. I saw this for a little while, but I've fixed the cause of the edge's empty target view. You probably have other issues if you don't have a valid view as an edge target. (The non-targeted edges look funny in the diagram too)
We could add protection code I suppose, but this would be masking the fact that the diagram is corrupt.  It's not valid in the runtime to have an edge without a target or source.
